tidbits.title: Remote and Uninhabited
tidbits.description: Bouvet Island is one of the most remote places on Earth, uninhabited and covered by glaciers, making it one of the least accessible islands globally.

tidbits.title: Discovered by a Norwegian
tidbits.description: The island was discovered by a Norwegian explorer in the 18th century and is now an uninhabited territory of Norway, primarily visited by research expeditions.

tidbits.title: Protected Nature Reserve
tidbits.description: Bouvet Island is a designated nature reserve, fostering unique ecosystems with seals, seabirds, and limited vegetation surviving in its harsh conditions.
